intro: Lycianthes tomentella, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, violet or purple flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Lycianthes tomentella is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
